title: CORLI: a linguistic consortium for corpus, language and interaction
segmentation: So as you.
You just see so.
The consortium is named Corpus Language Interaction and it is doing what's the name is calling for, and in fact it's involved in language, linguistic research, teaching and on corpus linguistics.

It's I would say it's a small part of Humanim, which means the digital humanities in France, which is a French government organization that provides resources and tools for digital minis and social science as a whole.
And there are several consortium depending on the field.
And the quality is one of them.
Mainly the idea behind Callie is that it's a network of laboratories in France.

And varies in official steering committee that represents something like right now 22 laboratories, but the numbers is changing some different and the goal in fact is to represent all corpus linguistic research in France.
Or I'll say the most possible.
Technically it's coordinated by function view from Institute of French Linguistics and Cooley exist since five years and we are in a six years but.
In fact, the 1st four years had a different name.
It was cool.

There were two consortium at a time and one what was called copy sickly, which is written in corpus and one that was working on all language and multimodal language and that you have been put together last year too for the new.
Network.
And the principle behind that network is that it's self organized.

It means this is not something top down and we tried to put as many people there wanted to work on the subject of helping people working on compass linguistics to normalize to give information, to provide information and to help other people and the committee in the pasture has changed quite a lot according to.
People that had no more time to work on.
For example, the network, but we're going out to new people coming in, and it really is quite every year is slightly different and technically the project and goal.
Of course we are evaluating are evaluated by the Scientific Committee of Humanism, and so sometimes it's it's OK for a couple of years.
Or sometimes we have to be evaluated every year dependence.
Cody is organized in two main ways and we have some general actions, but concerns all domains of corpus linguistics.
Or you could call that transversal actions and you have a work group, but I will talk about later on.
And the idea is that general action there's one action to help people describe resource.
We kind of resource that you want, fine, you won't find in repository's kind of resource what are, for example, ongoing in certain universities, that kind of thing.
And to help people describe data that exist or the work that exists in some places there's an action which is not working every year because of its no need for that often but.
Which is very important, at least for us in France right now.
It's the idea of evaluation of the quality of a corpus, because in France there is more more.
I will say importance given to corpus as tools.

From research I will say results from research and but you need this to be elevated so that we can prove that what we are producing is good and interesting and that people working when we're doing good job.
And so we've been discussing about providing ways too good to give a good evaluation over the data, and especially also saying that a good data is not only good from a scientific point of view.
It's also should be available and also should be in a format that people can use.
And so I'm going to.
To explain more about technical course information, that's something that we do nearly every year.

We have session about helping people to use corpus annotation tools like Elon Clans Pass, and you have also session about helping people using exploration tools like the Examiner AMETEK which are tools that are quite used.
Lots in France and mainly these tools are all say interface too.
Are queries or packages or in case of exam interface with CQP?
We also had technical calls that.
Video and song recording.

It's my see obvious, but when you are not fully specialized into it, it's not that easy to have very good video, very good audio and many people were quite interested in having more information about that so as to create the best corpus possible and also information about the kind of format they had to use.
Becausw in video and sounds often format change quite a lot and people are not fully.
Up to date about what we can use.
We had also several calls about using meta data more, but the way to code metadata and the way sometimes to use the software.
But people who used to code limited data.
A very important part of quality, since I would say the second year was the ID to help people finish their corpus.
I think it was one of the main goal at the very creation of a consortium from minimum saying that we should provide more corpus and make them a valuable and the ID is that in many cases research.
I will see research project have been striving quite a lot to obtain.
I would say scientific results, that kind of thing and often we lack some even knowledge, or so.

So it's small amounts of money, and often it's enough for to finish.

And we have also to be open at least Open Access for research.
For example, this year we had 25 submission and we accepted 13 of this submission.
For a total budget of 40,000 euros.
And the sort of the organization of work groups.
It's something different.

It's more idea to target the subfield or specific goal and 1st one important work group is to help people having information and also trying to gather all the information about corpus deposition and evaluation.
This is something that probably seems obvious to you, but most of the people working on linguistics.

Before I would say five years before we were nearly nothing about that kind of information, so we we are working on guidelines, technical course about corpus deposition, how to do it, what kind of format through people use, what kind of meta data you can put it, and so on.
There was also group viewer before and we pay.
Some people specialize in Lego.
Data and to provide guidelines and information about the legal procedure in France for Corporation so on, and that was very useful, specially to help people that were afraid.
But what I should do?
What can I do to help them having the most possible clear information about that?
It's from several for several years.
We've started with try to start the group about multilingual prelingual information, and it never started.
An this year.
There are new people in and I hope it will really start, but I cannot say anything because I have not yet information about what we have been able to do, and so the two final group which.
Our first exploration and formats.
This group is quite active and it's about gathering.
I would say we started from what the people were doing envelops.
So we started from the bottom trying to get as information as possible about what people were already in doing 1 by their own and then put together all these people and saying OK.
So now you can.
I would say exchange information exchange about information about how you do that and so on.
And so we have people saying, I, I want I want information, but that tool that whenever two OK so we can put it together and so.
But what tools exist?
What format do they use?
How the data can be prepared and what kind of things and also we had a group working on formats.
There were a lot of discussion about meta data, not about the format of a meditative but about the kind of information.
That is interesting to put in the media.
Especially we had the group working on oral language metadata because there is a lot of information that you can put on who is speaking where people are speaking.
What kind of interaction there are, and so on.
And it's it's different in all projects and so that we wanted to have to give people a way to put together hand and using the same kind of information.

And we had all had also were group working on TI formats and the way to come to do conversion between the software at our most used by actually by people in France on coding oral language data so that we could convert which data to TI and back.
And we are also working on.
Tools for Metal Edition, not tools about will save technical point of view, but tools that will provide nice interface for people to create or edit meta data.
Angle skip.
But we haven't.

Even if time and so there is another work group which is working on multi modality and new forms of communication, mainly where ID is to develop cutting edge practices about human interaction in gesture.
Visual language is cool verbal communication which is a subject which is quite hours.
A lot of people are working on that in France right now but also on computer mediated communication and social media corpora.

Because we have the same kind of problems, we have different kinds of parallel information and it's not always easy and often the classical tools are not the best to do that, or so you have either to say OK, there are specific tools that you might be able to use specific format that you might be able to use, or more often things like extend previous tools, previous existing tools and formats.
We are also trying to work on visualization of data.
Which is not an easy thing and provide of course information about corpus creation and tools in that kind of subject.
So finally I've got 2 two minutes to finish my presentation.
I will do just as you did before and so there were questions asked by the reviewers and how can quickly integrate into Clarin, which is of course an important thing.
First, as you probably know already, France now is an observer and there are already 2C center existing in France.
There is 1 Plan B center that I hope will be able to ask to be an official be center by the end of the year and what might be possible.
We have to discuss that more in detail in ourselves is to create automatically as a kind of case center.
As far as I seen, it's what we are doing is very close to what case center is doing an.
We might also do that with other consortium.

From the Manual Special Legal Consortium that is working on literature, it's called K and the called a consortium which is working on ethnological technology and corpus for geology, which we already have.
I will see a link with these people and so we might create altogether something or one by one.
I don't know exactly.
We were questioned about Medidata.

All I will say technical point of view of Medidata is that you are producing this idea of course already in well known formats such as orlak on TI and of course meta data can be automatically converted into two cmgi and there's no reason why this should not be done all the time and or general politics about meta data is that there is not only one format from a user personal view, its format can be converted.
And one very important thing is that all the things that you've been doing in Cali is asking two people to deposit, not requiring two people to deposit their data.
If they do not deposit their data in repository, then it's not available to anyone.
And that's bad.
And then of course because we are in Clarence or deposition means center Clarence Center and the final thing is that.

All the data, as I said before should be Open Access to research becausw as it did with data has been paid for by the government, often for project when it's normal that it's Open Access for research and I had a question about licenses and we do not stick to 1 license on another, but we stick to license for Open Access which is most and most people use.
For example CC by NC which correspond to why we don't want commercial use because we don't feel like it, but they want the data to be.
We know that we have been doing with data and other people can use it and change it and so that's it.
Thank you.
